decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission P/4181/22 Dated 09/02/2023

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: 

Covering Letter Dated 31/08/2022, Email Correspondence with Delivery Company (Dated 29/11/2022), Email Correspondence with Heineken (Dated 05/12/2022 and 06/12/2022), Operation Management Plan, Untitled Photo of Delivery Lorry, Untitled Photo of Delivery Lorry 2, CT1001 Rev.D1 (Existing Ground Floor Plan), CT1002 Rev. D1 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan), CT1003 Rev. D1 (Existing and Proposed Shopfront Elevations), CT1004 Rev. D1 (Existing and Proposed Rear Elevations), CT1005 Rev. D1 (Existing Side Elevations), CT1006 Rev. D1 (Existing Site Plan), CT1007 Rev. D1 (Proposed Site Plan), CT1008 Rev. D1 (Proposed Block Plan and Location Plan), Sound Insulation Investigation Report 25816.SII.01 Rev A, Reasonable Exemption Statement, Email from Applicant (Dated 01/02/2023), Email from Agent (Dated 30/01/2023), Email from Agent (Dated 07/02/2023).

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - The external surfaces of the new shopfront hereby approved shall be constructed and installed in accordance with the details provided within Drawing No. CT1003 Rev. D1 (Existing and Proposed Shopfront Elevations)

REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 4 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside of the following times: 11:00am - 23:30pm from Monday to Thursday and Sunday, 11:00am - 12:30am on Fridays and Saturdays.

REASON: To ensure the proper functioning of the commercial properties within the locality and protect the residential amenities of adjoining occupiers

Condition : 5 - Deliveries for the use hereby permitted shall not be carried out outside of the hours of 8am to 8pm on all days, and bottles shall not be thrown into external bins outside of the hours of 9am to 9pm on all days.

REASON: To ensure the proper functioning of the commercial properties within the locality and protect the residential amenities of adjoining occupiers.

Condition : 6 - Following the installation of the noise mitigation equipment detailed within the Covering Letter Dated 31/08/2022, the Email from the Agent (Dated 07/02/2022), and the Sound Insulation Investigation Report 25816.SII.01 Rev A, and before the use hereby permitted is brought into operation, a noise verification report shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted noise verification report shall demonstrate that noise exposure from the pub following the installation of the proposed noise mitigation equipment would be reasonably in accordance with projected noise levels detailed within the Sound Insulation Investigation Report 25816.SII.01 Rev A.

The noise verification report shall identify the highest possible noise levels generated through the use; including when live music is being played and when it is not, and this shall be calculated in respect to the closest noise sensitive receptors above.

Furthermore, details shall be provided on the type, location, and settings of the proposed noise limiter.

Following the approval of these details by the Local Planning Authority, proposed noise mitigation equipment shall be retained in situ unless agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents in accordance with Policies D3, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 7 - The proposed noise and litter management measures for smokers identified with the Email from the Applicant (Dated 01/02/2023) shall be in effect at all times throughout the pubï¿½s operation hours.

REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents and to manage impacts of littering in accordance with Policies D3, D11, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy DM1 and DM2 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: Variation of condition 4 (opening hours) attached to planning permission P/4181/22 dated 09/02/2023 to allow the closing time to change from 22:30 to 23:30 (Monday to Thursday and Sundays)
